thread.title: Report: China inks deal to buy 300 Boeing jets
thread.title_full: Report: China inks deal to buy 300 Boeing jets

title: Report: China inks deal to buy 300 Boeing jets
text:
Report: China inks deal to buy 300 Boeing jets September 23, 2015 
China's official news agency says Chinese companies have agreed with Boeing to buy 300 jets and build an aircraft final assembly plant in China in deals signed during President Xi Jinping's visit to the United States. 
The Xinhua news agency said Wednesday that a group of Chinese companies inked the jet purchase agreement after Xi's arrival in Seattle. 
The report said China Aviation Supplies Holding, ICBC Financial Leasing and China Development Bank Leasing signed the deal with Boeing. It gave no details of the plane models involved or the deal's value. 
State-owned Commercial Aircraft Corporation of China has also signed a cooperation agreement with the U.S. plane maker to build a 737 aircraft completion center in China. Boeing and Chinese firm to turn 'gutter oil' into jet fuel October 22, 2014 
US aircraft maker Boeing has set up a facility with a Chinese firm to transform waste cooking oil—the source of repeated food safety scandals—into jet fuel, it said Wednesday. China firm wins order for 30 homegrown passenger planes November 11, 2014 
China's main commercial aircraft company said on Tuesday that it had received a single order for 30 of its C919 passenger jets, bringing the total ordered to 430 planes. China regional jet certified to fly domestic routes December 31, 2014 
A Chinese-developed passenger plane has been certified by the country's aviation regulator, clearing the way for the ARJ21 regional jet to fly domestic routes, the manufacturer and state media said. China, Argentina agree on work for new nuclear power plants February 4, 2015 
Chinese and Argentine leaders on Wednesday signed a batch of agreements, including collaboration on two new nuclear power plants, as Beijing is strengthening its relations with the South American country. Chinese airline completes cooking oil fuel flight March 21, 2015 
A Chinese airline on Saturday completed the country's first commercial flight using biofuel, made from waste cooking oil, as the government seeks to promote greater environmental sustainability. Investment treaty between China and US key business goal September 23, 2015
